revised_title: Morphology and Infection of the Trypanosome Causing Disease in Man in Nyasaland
tldr: The study investigates the morphology and infection of the trypanosome causing disease in man in Nyasaland, focusing on the naturally infected dog strain. The research reveals that the strain closely resembles other wild Glossina morsitans strains and belongs to the same species as the trypanosome occurring in humans, wild game, and wild Glossina morsitans in the "Proclaimed Area" of Nyasaland. The study also highlights the differences in virulence and morphology between the naturally infected dog strain and the parent species.
